    LMirx - I Like Cheese

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.xrns)

    I like cheese and it is very good. Just the smell brings me peace and joy. There is no better thing for my bread, than cheese on the top for a wonderful time. I just cannot get this to render quite right. Plugins/sample libraries used: Hollywood Strings Gold and Hollywood Choirs Gold, plus the matching solo violin and cello

    LMirx - Blind Siren: Battle Mix

    Battle version of the theme of Aurora, the Blind Siren. Heavily inspired by The Leviathan Trilogy by DM DOKURO, from the Terraria Calamity mod soundtrack.

    LMirx - Upper Hand

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.xrns)

    This started as Eurobeat, and slowly spiralled out of control. The name is from this sounding like it would play when the hero has gotten the upper hand on the villain and is executing their epic coordinated plan to defeat them. Plugins used: Synth1, Cinematic Strings 2 with Kontakt 5

    LMirx - Sometimes I Reach Out and Touch the Stars

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.xrns)

    Theme of Star Painter, in an unfamiliar world. Plugins used: Cinematic Strings 2 via Kontakt 5

    LMirx - Sometimes I Look Up at the Stars

    Theme of Star Painter.

    Dave Rodgers - Deja Vu (LMirx Determined Cover)

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.xrns)

    Imagine: the car is racing towards the bend. The racer's behind, and they have only one chance to get back into the race. Against all odds, they have to make this drift. Plugins/sample libraries used: Cinematic Strings 2 via Kontakt 5, Virtual Playing Orchestra's drum kit with Plogue Sforzando

    LMirx - Boss Time

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.xrns)

    This one was inspired by the RPG Maker MV bundled music, and RPGs in general. If you have dblue's Glitch plugin, you can enable it on the master track for a somewhat glitchy version of the song.

    This started as an attempt to copy a song from the Shokugeki No Soma anime (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v90pvDofq5s&t=1307s). It ended up turning out quite different.

    LMirx - We Are Get Lucky

    • Ogg Vorbis

    Surprisingly I couldn't find a mashup of We Are Number One and Daft Punk - Get Lucky, despite them fitting together really well without that many changes. So I made one!

    LMirx - Dream March

    LMirx - City Night

    • FLAC

    • Project file (.sunvox)

    This one was sitting around in my WIP folder for ages, until I eventually decided to just call it finished.

    LMirx - Demo One

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.sunvox)

    Now this, this is a big one. This song started off as a chiptune, written as though for a demoscene demo. I got up to where the chiptune ends, and ran out of ideas. It lay around in my WIP folder for quite a while. Then one day I went back to it and thought, "Wouldn't this be awesome as a kind of mashup of chiptune, electro and acoustic instruments?" This is the result! If you do take a look at the source file in SunVox, behold the giant module graph in all its glory!

    LMirx - Sundance

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.sunvox)

    I played around with a few new things with this one, namely tempo and style changes. I'm pretty happy how it turned out.

    LMirx - Trudge

    NightRadio - Follow the Sun (LMirx Remix)

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.sunvox)

    Follow the Sun is one of the example songs bundled with SunVox, and it's also written by the creator. It's my favourite of the example songs. This remix uses a few instruments and patterns copied directly from the original, so I suppose this is kind of an edit as well?

    LMirx - Showtime

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.sunvox)

    Fast-paced endlessly-looping mostly-electronic song, with the plucky instrument I love so much. I made this in the early days of using SunVox, and sometime later I looked back on it sometimes and thought, "I have no idea how I'm going to make anything as awesome as this again." I love it.

    LMirx - Chip Thing

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis

    My first foray into using only simple waveforms in a song (ie. chiptune). I was trying to make a dubstep-like wobble bass, but it didn't work out and so I made this instead.

    LMirx - Destiny

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    "You can't escape your destiny." I love the plucky instrument in this song. I don't know what it is but I pinched it from "Inside a Dream" by Awesome and have since heard it in quite a few songs.

    LMirx - Lost

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    "It is all too easy to become lost in the pure vastness of a mind." Guitars! One of which is my sample, the other comes from "guitarv2" by Buzzer.

    LMirx - March

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    A short, mostly acoustic piece (as acoustic as you can get with samples, anyway). I learned that you could make snare rolls with the retrigger command, so I made a song with that in it!

    LMirx - Piano Thing

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    A calm song featuring a piano (unsurprisingly). I rather like this one. I didn't have any other ideas for what to call it, so the name isn't very original.

    LMirx - Prepare

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    "Are you ready to face the challenge?" I asked my friend to pick out some samples from a large collection of tracker modules as a composition challenge. He picked mostly orchestral samples, with a synth in the mix. This is what I made.

    LMirx - Searching

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    "Even though you may never find it, you still keep searching." A calm, slightly solemn piece, featuring a piano sample taken from "Beyond the Heart" by Awesome. Around the time I made this, I was playing around with making an isometric RPG. I thought this would make a good theme for exploring an island in the middle of the sea near the start of the game, with wind-through-grass noises in the background.

    David Larson, Mandopony - Double Rainboom (LMirx Techno Remix)

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    A remix of the theme of Double Rainboom, an MLP: FiM fan animation made by people all over the world (or something like that), that sadly was taken down by the lead producer. You can still find it online though. The module file for this is 18 megabytes because it contains the entire vocal track uncompressed.

    LMirx - Twilight

    "Embrace the twilight, live in it. It won't last." A little ambient piece that came from messing with a chord entry thing OpenMPT has.

    Koji Kondo - Song of Storms (LMirx 16-bit Cover)

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    LMirx - Never-ending Sorrow

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    "When there is no hope, sorrow overcomes all." An electronic 16-bit-ish song. This song was made for a small game I did with a few other people, for a 3D character modelling and animation course marketed as being video-game-oriented. They had to put something in there to justify that marketing!

    LMirx - Final Sacrifice

    • FLAC
    • Ogg Vorbis
    • Project file (.it)

    "The Final Sacrifice is your life." The first song I ever made (well, technically second, but we don't talk about the first)! Chord progression comes from "destiny" by Radix.
